name: The Hermitage Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night as we wanted to enjoy the Mt Cook experience. We thought it seemed expensive when we booked, especially as we had to pay up front but they have the monopoly so can charge what they like. We booked the package including dinner as the prospect of dining with the views of Mt Cook was so tempting. Check-in was fine, if a little perfunctionary and we found our own way to the room. We had not booked a mountain view so our room was down a long corridor somewhere in the middle of the building. It was raining very heavily when we arrived and part of the car park was flooded and unuseable. The rooms are very average and certainly not luxurious! Not the hotels fault but the weather had still not improved by dinner so we got no views. If the food had been better this would not have been quite such a disappointment but it was a very average meal, again not worth the cost. We enjoyed the museum which we found very informative. We slept well and awoke to sunshine and enjoyed a super walk with fabulous views of Mt Cook and all the surrounding mountains. We skipped breakfast but enjoyed a cup of coffee on the terrace before departing. We achieved our objective of getting to see Mt Cook in all it's glory, something a brief in/out journey might not have achieved but the Hermitage really needs to do better!
reviews.title: Not Good Value

reviews.text: The rooms and view were quite lovely but the food leaves something to be desired. The restaurant caters to more asian type food and did not have a very good variety. The service was excellent, just poor quality food. We would return, however just bring our own food.
reviews.title: Amazing view but horrible food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we arrived at the Hermitage on motorcyles impromptu, based on weather forecast. We only had time for one night and decided to treat ourselves to a room on level 2 with a spectacular view of Mt Cook. It was however disappointing to have to keep the sliding door to the balcony closed as some sort of air conditioning unit directly below and in front of the balcony came on around 2pm and stayed on until the evening. We were unable to sit on the balcony to enjoy the view and the sounds of nature with the constant humming sound emanating from the a/c unit. For the standard of the hotel and the price, I would have expected these units to be placed at the rear of the building. Consequently we were unable to leave door open for fresh air. Room well appointed and comfortable, bathroom practical but too small for 2 and the corner of the vanity is dangerously placed to walk into as you enter or leave the bathroom. We enjoyed the views and the location but found the hotel over-priced in terms of the amenities and the facilities. Bar was understaffed and when I asked to have a taste of the 2 merlots available in order to decide which bottle to buy, I had to convince them to indulge me in my request
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: My overall stay in this hotel was excellent, the staff were patient, accommodating and helpful. Awesome stay! Fantastic location and amazing scenery of mountains, 360 degrees of it! We experienced sunshine, rain and fog in the 3 nights were were there, so the views were changing beautifully every day.
reviews.title: Great place if you're visiting Mount Cook

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had blocked a cottage at the hotel which had some amazing views of Mt Cook. Considering we had visited this hotel in the month of Nov, we didnt need any air conditioning and just needed a heater. The room was well equipped with a kitchenette, etc. Only challenge is the washroom which is super tiny with a low roof (suited for Japanese mainly)..watch your head as the washroom is real tiny! The food was okay for the first day and then quickly realised that one is better off cooking in the room than eating the overpriced and bland/ tasteless food.
reviews.title: Amazing Location but could do with an upgrade
Back in time, not in a good way
reviews.text: Let me start with the positive, the location is absolutely stunning. Now onto the hotel itself, remember those dreadful hotels of the 70's?  They remain at the Hermitage.  For what it is, this place is overpriced by a factor of about three.  The hallways are dingy (see photo), the paint is flaking off the balconies, our room had no real closet with a door (see photo), the iron and hair dryer were placed on the floor in the door-less closet space, the room smelled of old vacuum cleaner bags, the safe was too high for any non-mutant to see into it, and the sink and toilet were arranged with insufficient space between them (about a foot between them). The staff were poorly trained. Yes they were very nice, but upon check-in, they forgot to take my credit card info and called me back to get that, this seems basic.  The next morning when I asked about other breakfast options, the lady at the desk incorrectly told me that the only other options were in Twizel (45 minutes away).  That seemed like a deceptive ploy to get us to eat at the hotel as there was a decent place (Mountaineer cafe) about a 5 minutes walk away.  At night we had dinner at the Panorama restaurant, despite the "reservations essential" comment, the place was about 20% full.  Food was heavy and an overly-complicated mix assembled in a pretty fashion on the plate.  I laughed out loud at the combination of items on the plate.  If you can avoid this place, do so.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a "standard" room at this hotel for $235/night which turned out to be in the old section of the hotel without a view of Mt. Cook and surprise! no air conditioning. The sliding glass door (no screen) opened onto a balcony shared with all the other rooms on that floor so leaving it open was not an option. We did sleep with the windows open (no screens). We were offered a fan but decided to ask for either another room or a refund for our second night. They wanted us to pay more for a room with air conditioning, which we did not want to do since we thought our room was already overpriced. Food was quite expensive too. Continental breakfast was $19 pp, full breakfast $29 pp and dinner $59 pp. There was one other restaurant in the "village" which apparently had to fight hard to be allowed there. The Hermitage has mostly a captive audience and seems to cater primarily to tour groups. Thank goodness they let us check out after only one night since my allergies were going crazy sleeping without air conditioning. We cannot recommend this hotel even though the views of Mt. Cook are spectacular. If you want to walk the Hooker ValleyTrack, drive in to Mt. Cook for the day and then drive out immediately afterwards!
reviews.title: Very over priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on a perfect day: sun on Mt Cook with snow, in summer! We arrived early and were allowed 2 hours early in our room, which was great. Beautiful room, very comfortable even without a view of Mt Cook. The bench outside was a plus. We were a little disappointed that WiFi was not free here, as it is not cheap to stay here: many cheaper places give you free WiFi, if you spend more than $10, and we definitely spent more. The fridge is also quite small. We took the sightseeing trip on the glacier lake, which was amazing: boating with icebergs! The buffet breakfast was delicious and more than adequate, (we had the one without the cooked food). All the staff was very friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Hermitage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned home from a magical weekend at the Hermitage, from the moment we turned off to Mt Cook we knew we were in for something special
reviews.title: Dont Read The Other Reviews! Its Amazing!
Spectacular location - great for a short stay.
reviews.text: Its our 10 year wedding anniversary weekend & things could not have been any better - the service from the start was amazing, the staff a constant reminder that they were there to help & enhance anything the could at any beckon call

I stayed in one of the chalets, and found it to be VERY small and cramped. The views, however, were pretty amazing, but hey, a trash can in front of Mount Cook has great views. The kitchen in the chalet was ok, though, because it had a stovetop. The chalet did manage to stay standing during a fierce storm, which was a relief.
reviews.title: The chalets- good views, but tiny, cramped rooms with no service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got the continental breakfast, and was absolutely disgusted to discover that a lot of the "clean" plates were in fact dirty, covered with sauce and other disgusting unknown substances. This is absolutely filthy. You can't eat breakfast off dirty plates! And the breakfast was fairly expensive too. On the upside, the staff at breakfast were very nice.
reviews.title: Great view but little else to commend it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want the best view going of Mt Cook then you can't do better than this hotel. Unfortunately it is also the most expensive accommodation we have stayed in during our 1 month to date NZ tour. The hotel itself is tired and dated. The furnishings are dull and the corridor to our room looked like a drab second rate motel. The room itself was OK but only because of the view.
reviews.title: Monopoly on Mt Cook

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The so-called 'village' is not what you'd expect. There are no shops and a distinct lack of any competition whatsoever to the Hermitage. It's a good example of modern feudalism where everything is controlled. The only eatery we found outside the hotel was the Old Mountaineer who only managed to get planning consent a few years ago after fighting the Hermitage all the way.
reviews.title: Expensive, but incredible location

reviews.text: We did have a buffet in the hotel which was very good and in fairness the drink prices are not excessive.
reviews.title: Nice hotel nice room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hermitage is in a great location and the view of Mt. Cook from our room was spectacular.
reviews.title: great location, great views, but needs updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Glacier Explorers Boat Tour to The Tasman Glacier Terminal Lake was definitely worth doing. The hiking was also very good. Dinner at the Panorama Room was nice, however the buffet breakfast was just OK. Yes, this place definitely looks dated, especially the hallways. And yes, it is overpriced.
reviews.title: Overpriced and badly in need of update

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the motel accommodations so I have no idea what the hotel rooms looked like, but our room was a real let down and way too expensive for what you get. Just tired, everything was in need of an update. The kitchen did not inspire us to cook, and indeed didn’t seem like it had been used in a while (cobwebs & dead moth on the cookware/plates). The bedding was old & not appealing. Our view was uninspiring too. The Hermitage’s breakfast was OK, and we had a good (but again overpriced) meal at the Panorama restaurant. The service throughout was disappointing – I think there must be high turnover, and a lot of people really didn’t seem to know what was going on, although most were friendly & at least tried. The national park is beautiful & you’ll spend most of your time outside the room (weather permitting!) so perhaps looking into one of the cheaper, basic, non-Hermitage properties is the best option.
reviews.title: apart from the view everything was poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A typical airport hotel, but with no airport nearby. What I mean is people stay for one night only and probably will never come back again, unless they work for an airline. Service was non existing. Nobody who help you with your luggage. Then you try to find your room through long and nestled corridors who look like, I imagine, corridors in prisons. Early morning you have hordes of tourists in this corridors shouting around, to make sure you don't need a wake up call.
reviews.title: Stunning views but mediocre service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food in the a la carte restaurant was uninspiring and took ages to be served.
reviews.title: Great Views underwhelming service

description: From an intrepid journey through glacial valleys to a mouth-watering culinary dining adventure, The Hermitage Hotel is the perfect 'base camp' to discover your Peak Experience. Choose from premium hotel rooms, motel units or cozy chalets. Add world-class activities such as Glacier Explorers, Tasman Valley 4WD and Argo Tours, Big Sky Stargazing, Encounter Day Walks, scenic flights or the visual extravaganza of the Sir Edmund Hillary Alpine Centre and you have a unique, year-round alpine adventure perfect for the family holiday or your next romantic getaway.
